title: How to Make Chicken Taquitos

steps.headline: Cook the chicken.
Turn on your frying pan and start heating up the oil.
Put the tortillas into the microwave for about two minutes.
steps.description: Heat up as many as you want to make tacos from.

steps.headline: Put the shredded chicken slices in a line at the edges of a tortilla.
steps.description: Roll it up carefully, making sure no chicken can get out.

steps.headline: Put the taco into the frying pan and let it fry until the tortilla has turned brown and crispy.
steps.description: Repeat this until you have finished with all the tortillas and chicken.

steps.headline: Put shredded pieces of lettuce on top of your tacos and crumbled cheese over the lettuce.
steps.description: You can also add salsa, beans, or sour cream.

text:
Cook the chicken. If you prefer to make potato or meat tacos then cook then whichever way you prefer. The same goes for chicken preparation--any which way is good. Remove the skin from the chicken and cut it into pieces. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/490772-1-bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-490772-1-bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/490772-1-bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-490772-1-bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Put the water to boil in pot big enough to fit the chicken. Put the following ingredients into the pot: 2 spoons of salt, 1/2 an onion cut into chunks, 3 garlic cloves, 1 teaspoon of oregano, the chicken pieces. Leave the chicken in for about 20 minutes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/490772-1-bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-490772-1-bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/490772-1-bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-490772-1-bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Take the chicken out of the pot and make sure it is cooked. If it is not put it back in for a few more minutes. Otherwise let the chicken cool. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/490772-1-bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-490772-1-bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/490772-1-bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-490772-1-bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Start shredding the pieces of chicken. These strips will go in the taco so make sure the pieces are the right size. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/490772-1-bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-490772-1-bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/490772-1-bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-490772-1-bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Turn on your frying pan and start heating up the oil. Put the tortillas into the microwave for about two minutes. Heat up as many as you want to make tacos from. Put the shredded chicken slices in a line at the edges of a tortilla. Roll it up carefully, making sure no chicken can get out. Put the taco into the frying pan and let it fry until the tortilla has turned brown and crispy. Repeat this until you have finished with all the tortillas and chicken. Put shredded pieces of lettuce on top of your tacos and crumbled cheese over the lettuce. You can also add salsa, beans, or sour cream. Enjoy!
